## Problem

In the balanced sample of counties, several states contribute very few counties, in some cases fewer than four. This undermines the interpretation of quartile-based effects, since within-state quartiles are poorly defined when the number of counties is small.

``` stata

------------+-----------------------------------
```

## Task

> Let's try re-running the Fig 1 and Fig 2's (3 versions each: pre_q; pre_q + inc_q; pre_q + inc_q\*reform_types), with the sample limited to states that are (i) never treated or (ii) ever-treated and have 10 or more counties meeting the balance criteria.
